Description: Fragment of a pottery cup; low flaring ring foot and lower part of bowl; inside of bowl glazed black, remains of an added red stripe and central dot; on outside, black stripe around outside of foot and lower part of bowl; light brown clay Munsell 7.5YR 7/3 (pink).
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (G), chamber 29
Curator's comments: Findspot number '29' written beside drawing in Petrie 1888, pl. xxxii, 6
Bibliographic references: Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 329)
Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (pl. xxxii, 6)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.211)
Acquisition notes: Found unregistered in the Department in 2010, in a box with other sherds from Tell Dafana.
